Learn about the Ukrainian app Calorize,: Learn about the Ukrainian app Calorize, its founders, and mission. A simple and convenient tool for calorie control.
about us, Calorize, Lialia Sakhno, Ulian: about us, Calorize, Lialia Sakhno, Uliana Sakhno, calorie control, Ukrainian product
Calorize was born out of a real need. Se: Calorize was born out of a real need. Seven years ago, I, Lialia Sakhno, decided to lose weight and started searching for the perfect app that met all my requirements: simplicity, scientific accuracy, precision, and no unnecessary features. Unfortunately, I couldn’t find such a tool. All existing apps were either too gamified or lacked precise calculations for custom recipes, including adjustments for evaporation or moisture loss during cooking.
That’s why I decided to create my own ap: That’s why I decided to create my own app with a focus on convenience, functionality, and minimalism. Calorize is the result of my years of programming experience and my desire to help others achieve their healthy eating goals.
I am Lialia Sakhno, an experienced Larav: I am Lialia Sakhno, an experienced Laravel developer with many years of expertise in working on complex projects. In this project, I am responsible for all the code, from the backend to the design. Since I specialize more in backend development, creating the design was a challenge for me, but I thoroughly enjoyed overcoming it.
My girlfriend, Uliana Sakhno, helps me t: My girlfriend, Uliana Sakhno, helps me test the app and find ways to make it even better. Together, we aim to create a product that becomes a reliable assistant for everyone who has chosen the path to a healthy lifestyle.
We believe that everyone deserves a conv: We believe that everyone deserves a convenient and accurate tool to monitor their diet. Our mission is to help people become healthier and achieve their dietary goals without unnecessary complications.
Simplicity, minimalism, precision, and s: Simplicity, minimalism, precision, and scientific approach are the core values we instill in Calorize.
Accurate calculations of calories, prote: Accurate calculations of calories, proteins, fats, and carbohydrates
Unique feature to create custom recipes: Unique feature to create custom recipes considering the cooking method
Tools to track progress and achieve goal: Tools to track progress and achieve goals
In the future, we plan to add new featur: In the future, we plan to add new features such as a barcode scanner for easy product addition, AI-powered tools for creating personalized meal plans, and an expanded product database.
We believe that together with you, we ca: We believe that together with you, we can create a healthy and inspiring future for everyone.
Learn how Calorize ensures the security: Learn how Calorize ensures the security and privacy of your data. Get acquainted with our privacy policy.
privacy policy, Calorize, data protectio: privacy policy, Calorize, data protection, confidentiality

Your data is protected using modern encr: Your data is protected using modern encryption methods and security protocols. Only authorized personnel have access to your data, and solely for the purposes of completing necessary tasks.
Do we share your data with third parties: Do we share your data with third parties?
We do not share your personal data with: We do not share your personal data with third parties without your consent, except as required by law.
You have the right to know what data we: You have the right to know what data we collect and how we use it.

We may update this privacy policy from t: We may update this privacy policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes through our app or via email.

Why Calorize? Simple, fast, and powered: Why Calorize? Simple, fast, and powered by AI
Most calorie apps fail because logging i: Most calorie apps fail because logging is tedious. Calorize flips it: you describe your food in a message, the AI understands it, finds the right product, and updates your diary. You stay consistent — results follow.
Add, edit, delete, or copy meals by chat: Add, edit, delete, or copy meals by chat. Short messages work, and recent history helps pick the right variant — but your words always win (e.g. “lean”).
Search fast, pick exact matches, and sto: Search fast, pick exact matches, and stop guessing. Great for branded foods, supermarket products, and everyday staples.
Build your recipes from ingredients (eve: Build your recipes from ingredients (even other recipes), keep nutrition per 100g, and let Calorize handle the calculations for calories and macros.
Track calories, proteins, fats, and carb: Track calories, proteins, fats, and carbs. See trends, stay on target, and adjust based on real data — not vibes.
Built with the heart of an engineer — an: Built with the heart of an engineer — and a daily user
Calorize was created by a person who tra: Calorize was created by a person who tracks food every day and continuously uses the product. The goal is simple: make calorie and macro tracking so effortless that you can stay consistent for months — not days.
The AI assistant reduces taps and choice: The AI assistant reduces taps and choices — you just describe what you ate.
Fast search, recipes, copy meals, edits,: Fast search, recipes, copy meals, edits, and a huge Ukrainian database — built for real-life use.
We keep iterating based on real daily us: We keep iterating based on real daily use — so the app stays simple, fast, and useful.
How the AI calorie diary works: How the AI calorie diary works
Calorize is a functional calorie countin: Calorize is a functional calorie counting app with an AI assistant. It understands natural language, finds products, and updates your diary with calories and macros.
“a bowl of borscht”, “200g chicken”, “co: “a bowl of borscht”, “200g chicken”, “coffee with milk”
Uses search + your recent diary to pick: Uses search + your recent diary to pick the most likely variant, and asks only when needed.
Saved to the correct meal with grams and: Saved to the correct meal with grams and macros. Edit later by message.
Calorize keeps it simple: quick logging,: Calorize keeps it simple: quick logging, accurate nutrition, and an AI assistant that helps you stay consistent. Create your account and try it today.
People stick with Calorize because it’s: People stick with Calorize because it’s fast: the AI assistant removes the friction of daily logging.
“I finally log food consistently. I just: “I finally log food consistently. I just message what I ate, and the AI adds it to my diary. Tracking feels effortless.”
“The product database is huge, but the A: “The product database is huge, but the AI makes it simple. I track calories and macros without spending my day in the app.”

Sport Doesn't Make You Thin: Why Exercis: Sport Doesn't Make You Thin: Why Exercise Often Leads to Weight Gain
Exercise is important for health, but it: Exercise is important for health, but its effect on weight is variable. Learn why some people don't lose weight from training or even gain weight due to compensatory mechanisms.
exercise and weight, sport and weight lo: exercise and weight, sport and weight loss, energy compensation, appetite and exercise, NEAT
Exercise is important for health, but it: Exercise is important for health, but its effect on weight is variable. Some people don't lose weight from training or even gain weight due to compensatory mechanisms: increased appetite, compensatory energy intake, and changes in daily energy expenditure outside of training.
The popular model \"move more — eat less: The popular model "move more — eat less" assumes that exercise automatically creates an energy deficit and leads to weight loss. However, in clinical studies, weight loss from exercise interventions is often less than predicted or absent.
The main reasons are energy compensation: The main reasons are energy compensation (increased energy intake), changes in appetite control, and possible reduction in non-exercise activity (NEAT). This article summarizes the key mechanisms and explains why weight gain after starting exercise may be a predictable consequence of physiology, not "lack of discipline".
Weight loss from exercise is often lower: Weight loss from exercise is often lower than predicted due to energy compensation.
Some people experience increased energy: Some people experience increased energy intake or altered appetite control after exercise.
Compensation can be behavioral (more foo: Compensation can be behavioral (more food) and/or energetic (less movement outside the gym).
There is significant inter-individual va: There is significant inter-individual variability in response to exercise (some people are "non-responders" to expected weight loss).
Exercise is beneficial for cardiometabol: Exercise is beneficial for cardiometabolic health even without weight loss, but "exercise = weight loss" is not a universal rule.
Theoretically, adding exercise should in: Theoretically, adding exercise should increase total energy expenditure and lead to weight loss. However, in real interventions, weight loss is often lower than calculated.
This is shown in classic energy analysis: This is shown in classic energy analysis of causes of "under-loss" from exercise: part of the deficit is negated by increased energy intake, reduced non-exercise activity, or physiological adaptations.
2) Compensatory Energy Intake: How Exerc: 2) Compensatory Energy Intake: How Exercise Can Increase Appetite
Systematic review and meta-analysis in a: Systematic review and meta-analysis in adults with overweight/obesity shows that on average the effects of exercise programs on energy intake and appetite are small. However, it also highlights significant variability: some people demonstrate changes in appetite control and/or energy intake that reduce the expected energy deficit.
In a randomized controlled trial of 12-w: In a randomized controlled trial of 12-week aerobic training, it was shown that people can compensate for the energy spent on exercise, and the scale of compensation differs between participants and may depend on the "dose" of exercise.
Importantly: \"appetite\" is not just th: Importantly: "appetite" is not just the feeling of hunger. It's a complex of signals that includes hormonal and neural mechanisms, and review literature describes that exercise can affect appetite regulation through multiple pathways (including hormonal and metabolite signals).
Even if a person honestly performs train: Even if a person honestly performs training, total daily energy expenditure may increase less than expected if the body "saves" energy outside the gym. This can manifest as reduced spontaneous activity (NEAT), less movement throughout the day, or other changes in energy behavior.
Generalizing reviews on energy balance e: Generalizing reviews on energy balance emphasize that weight changes during interventions depend not only on the training itself, but on the total behavioral and physiological response of the body (energy intake, body composition, energy expenditure).
4) Why It \"Works\" for Some But Not Oth: 4) Why It "Works" for Some But Not Others
Scientific papers regularly highlight in: Scientific papers regularly highlight inter-individual variability in response to exercise. This means that two people can perform a comparable exercise program but have different weight results due to differences in compensatory energy intake, appetite changes, changes in energy expenditure, and body composition.
5) Why \"Just Eat Less\" Is a Poor Scien: 5) Why "Just Eat Less" Is a Poor Scientific Model
When someone is told to \"just close you: When someone is told to "just close your mouth", it's often based on the assumption that appetite is completely voluntary. But intervention data shows that the body can compensate for physical activity both behaviorally (through food) and energetically (through other components of daily expenditure), making "simple advice" scientifically incomplete.
Exercise is a powerful tool for health,: Exercise is a powerful tool for health, but not a guarantee of weight loss.
Compensatory energy intake and changes i: Compensatory energy intake and changes in appetite control can "eat up" the expected deficit.
NEAT reduction and other adaptations can: NEAT reduction and other adaptations can additionally reduce the effect of exercise on weight.
Inter-individual differences in response: Inter-individual differences in response to exercise are the norm, not the "exception".
If you're not losing weight from exercis: If you're not losing weight from exercise or gaining — this is consistent with research data and is not automatic proof of "laziness".
For weight control, additional strategie: For weight control, additional strategies are often needed: monitoring energy intake, working with appetite, individualizing exercise load.
If appetite is a pronounced problem, it': If appetite is a pronounced problem, it's worth discussing with a doctor possible medical causes and treatment options (including pharmacotherapy if indicated).
This material is informational in nature: This material is informational in nature and does not replace consultation with a doctor.
Track what you eat, not just what you bu: Track what you eat, not just what you burn
Monitoring your food intake helps you un: Monitoring your food intake helps you understand your true energy balance and make informed decisions.
Exercise is important for health, but it: Exercise is important for health, but its effect on weight is variable. Learn why some people don't lose weight or even gain weight after starting exercise — and it's not about discipline.
Exercise is important for health but its: Exercise is important for health but its effect on weight is variable. Learn why some people do not lose weight from training or even gain weight.
Water supports energy, digestion, appeti: Water supports energy, digestion, appetite control, and metabolism - here's what the research says and how much to aim for.
Rebound Is Not a Relapse: Why Weight Com: Rebound Is Not a Relapse: Why Weight Comes Back and Why That Is Normal
Weight regain after weight loss is not a: Weight regain after weight loss is not a failure of willpower. It is a predictable biological response driven by hormones and metabolism that can persist for years.
weight regain, rebound effect, weight ma: weight regain, rebound effect, weight maintenance, appetite hormones, metabolic adaptation
Weight regain after weight loss is not a: Weight regain after weight loss is not a sign of weak willpower or a motivation failure. It is a predictable biological response to fat loss. Hormonal, metabolic, and neural adaptations can persist for years and push body weight upward.
Rebound effect: weight regain is normal: Rebound effect: weight regain is normal
In most people who lose a substantial am: In most people who lose a substantial amount of weight, part or all of it returns over the following years.
This is often interpreted as a relapse,: This is often interpreted as a relapse, loss of control, or lack of discipline. However, modern research shows that the rebound effect is driven by long-lasting hormonal and metabolic adaptations: stronger hunger signals, weaker satiety signals, and lower resting energy expenditure.
This article reviews the key rebound mec: This article reviews the key rebound mechanisms and explains why weight regain is usually biology doing its job, not a character flaw.
After weight loss, appetite hormones can: After weight loss, appetite hormones can shift toward hunger for a long time.
Metabolic adaptation can persist for yea: Metabolic adaptation can persist for years after weight loss.
Most people partially or fully regain th: Most people partially or fully regain the lost weight over time.
Rebound is not an eating disorder and no: Rebound is not an eating disorder and not a relapse. It is a protective response of the body.
Weight maintenance is usually harder tha: Weight maintenance is usually harder than weight loss itself.
1) Why Weight Regain Is the Statistical: 1) Why Weight Regain Is the Statistical Norm
Long-term follow-ups after diets and wei: Long-term follow-ups after diets and weight loss programs show a stable pattern: within 2–5 years, most people regain a large share of the lost weight or return close to baseline.
Culture frames this as a personal failur: Culture frames this as a personal failure. Physiology frames it as an expected consequence of how the brain and hormones react to sustained energy loss.
2) The Hormonal Trap After Weight Loss: 2) The Hormonal Trap After Weight Loss
After weight loss, appetite regulation c: After weight loss, appetite regulation changes significantly. A large study published in the New England Journal of Medicine showed that for at least a year after weight loss:
These changes are not short-term. They c: These changes are not short-term. They can persist even when weight stabilizes, creating chronic biological pressure toward regain.
3) Metabolic Adaptation: The Body Burns: 3) Metabolic Adaptation: The Body Burns Less Than It Should
Beyond appetite hormones, the energy eco: Beyond appetite hormones, the energy economy changes after weight loss. This phenomenon is known as metabolic adaptation or adaptive thermogenesis.
A classic 6-year follow-up of The Bigges: A classic 6-year follow-up of The Biggest Loser participants showed that even years after extreme weight loss, resting metabolic rate remained significantly lower than expected for their body weight and composition.
This means maintaining the new weight ma: This means maintaining the new weight may require eating less than calorie calculators would predict. Over time, this increases the feeling of chronic energy shortage and reinforces hunger.
4) Why Rebound Does Not Equal a Relapse: 4) Why Rebound Does Not Equal a Relapse

When a person starts eating more after r: When a person starts eating more after restriction, it is not always weakness. It can be the brain trying to restore energy reserves it perceives as necessary for survival.
In this context, rebound is not patholog: In this context, rebound is not pathology but a logical adaptation of the energy regulation system shaped by evolution.

At the center of appetite regulation is: At the center of appetite regulation is the hypothalamus—a small but critical brain structure. It integrates signals from peripheral hormones (ghrelin, leptin, insulin, PYY) and generates hunger or satiety commands.
Two key hypothalamic neuron populations: Two key hypothalamic neuron populations have opposite roles: some promote eating (NPY/AgRP) while others suppress it (POMC/CART). The balance between these systems strongly shapes whether a person feels hungry or full.
When this balance shifts toward hunger,: When this balance shifts toward hunger, motivation cannot fully cancel it out. This is a direct neural drive to act, not a psychological whim.
Appetite is not just “in the moment”—it: Appetite is not just “in the moment”—it reflects long-term hormonal dynamics. Two key players are ghrelin and leptin.
Ghrelin is produced in the stomach and s: Ghrelin is produced in the stomach and signals the brain that food is needed. It rises before meals and can increase after restriction.
Leptin is produced by fat tissue and sup: Leptin is produced by fat tissue and suppresses appetite. After weight loss, leptin drops, and the brain interprets it as a threat to energy reserves.
A classic New England Journal of Medicin: A classic New England Journal of Medicine study showed that after weight loss, ghrelin remains elevated and leptin remains reduced for at least a year—even when body weight stabilizes.

Besides homeostatic appetite (energy nee: Besides homeostatic appetite (energy needs), there is a hedonic component—eating for pleasure. It is strongly linked to the dopamine reward system.
After weight loss and prolonged dieting,: After weight loss and prolonged dieting, reward circuits can become more reactive to food cues (sight, smell, taste), increasing craving even without true energy need.
Neuroimaging studies show that after wei: Neuroimaging studies show that after weight loss, reward center responses to food can be stronger than before dieting—creating a subjective feeling of “loss of control” that reflects neural adaptation, not weak character.
Even when someone tries to restrict food: Even when someone tries to restrict food consciously, it requires sustained activation of the prefrontal cortex—regions involved in self-control.
But when the hypothalamus keeps sending: But when the hypothalamus keeps sending hunger signals and the reward system increases food value, cognitive control tends to fatigue over time.
